title: Rate equation based on initial rates

content.question: Trial <math alttext="the molar concentration of A 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></math> <math alttext="the molar concentration of B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[B]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Initial rate <math alttext="molar per second " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>M</mi><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> 1 0.10 0.50 <math alttext="2.5 times 10 to the negative 4 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>2.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> 2 0.20 0.50 <math alttext="5.0 times 10 to the negative 4 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>5.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> 3 0.30 0.05 <math alttext="5.0 times 10 to the negative 5 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>5.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> 4 0.30 0.10 <math alttext="1.0 times 10 to the negative 4 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> An experiment was conducted to determine the rate law for the reaction <math alttext="A 2 gas plus B gas react to produce A 2 B gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>B</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>B</mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The table above shows the data collected. Based on the data in the table, which statement is correct?

choices.label: Since the rate law can be expressed as <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of A 2 squared " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msub><mrow><mtext>[A</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, tripling the concentration of <math alttext="A 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> will cause a 9-fold increase in the rate of the reaction.

Since the rate law can be expressed as <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of A 2, times the molar concentration of B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">]</mo><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mtext>B</mtext><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, doubling the concentrations of <math alttext="A 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></math> will quadruple the rate of the reaction.

Since the rate law can be expressed as <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of A 2, squared times the molar concentration of B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msub><mrow><mtext>[A</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mtext>[B]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, tripling the concentration of <math alttext="A 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> while keeping the concentration of <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> constant will triple the rate of the reaction.

Since the rate law can be expressed as <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of A 2, times the molar concentration of B squared " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">]</mo><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mtext>B</mtext><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, doubling the concentration of <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> while keeping the concentration of <math alttext="A 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> constant will double the rate of the reaction.

content.answer: Since the rate law can be expressed as <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of A 2, times the molar concentration of B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">]</mo><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mtext>B</mtext><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, doubling the concentrations of <math alttext="A 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></math> will quadruple the rate of the reaction.

skill.text: 5.C: Explain the relationship between variables within an equation when one variable changes.
